ratings.question_text: I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: What is the name of your TA?
comments: na

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: na
FES needs to invite Professor Koomey to return soon and attract more professors like him. He's incredibly engaging and concerned about our education.

It focuses less on teaching students facts, and more about different ways of processing, thinking about, and critiquing information. It also does a great job of making forecasting models for climate and energy tangible.
Learning about energy forecasting and how to evaluate the projections given by people.
Professor Koomey was critical to the success of the course. The subject matter and readings were also very interesting and well chosen.
I enjoyed the small class size and personal attention in class. Class discussion was mainly fruitful.
The set up was good. The professor was very helpful.
Understanding the mechanics of forecasting in Energy topics.
casual discussion/seminar formatpaper assignment
Gaining a better knowledge of what goes into economic forecasting of climate impacts and energy systems.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: This class doesn't need improvement, it just needs to be offered every year and probably to a larger number of students.

I felt like the course would have benefited from a bit more structure. A few problem-set type assignments would have complemented the individual projects. I also think discussions needed some more guidance - there was a tendency to range too far off-topic and to become dominated by a few individuals.
Readings / lectures need a bit more structure.More group presentations / feedback on the papers being developed.
structure/key takeaways

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Excellent, Professor Koomey gave us each ample personal attention and feedback on our projects.
Very good! He even allowed us to meet him after hours early or late or even at his place.

Excellent. Professor Koomey was by far the most engaged, most responsive and most helpful professor I have taken a class from. His commitment to student projects was essential in helping them along through the semester.
Jon Koomey provided special meet-up sessions to aid us with our projects which were generally productive and useful.
Awesome.
Great!
Professor Koomey was very helpful and willing to meet.

Professor Koomey was easy to contact, even though he traveled to California during part of the week. He really set a high standard for communication, one unparalleled by most New Haven-based faculty members. Impressive.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This was a great capstone course for all of my energy and climate coursework. It's one of the best advanced classes students can take in this area, and has both academic and professional applications.
I'm interested in energy policy--so quite apt.

This course helped me gain perspective on the use and abuse of forecasting modeling. Generally it has made me a better critic of usefulness of models and various approaches to creating scenario analyses for more informed decision making. As a student interested in policy, this was a very useful course.
Straight at the core of my interest in energy issues.
Gives you an opportunity to dig deep into a topic of your preference and understand forecasting in that area.
As an MBA candidate who is interested in the connection between energy industry and policy, this was a very valuable view into the research that influences policymakers.
This course was not in my background area, but I'd had exposure to modeling during my summer internship. I think it's important for anyone going into the climate policy or energy fields.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I was excited to study under professor Koomey, and the subject matter appeared to be more challenging then most other courses at FES.
B/c of my interests in energy.
I wanted to understand how data analysis and modeling was used to drive energy forecasts.
I wanted to explore an energy area and work with this professor.
Understand how forecasts are produced.
same as above: As an MBA candidate who is interested in the connection between energy industry and policy, this was a very valuable view into the research that influences policymakers.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes
Yes

Although executing a term paper was extremely valuable, I would have enjoyed performing multiple exercises for different energy case scenarios as well to get a better sense of how models are constructed and used.
Yes.
Sure did!
yes
It surpassed them.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Thisclass exceeded even my high expectations. It will be one of the most useful and memorable classes that I took at FES.
Yes
Yes.
yes!
yes

comments: na

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Important to be self-motivated and able to work throughout the semester without the structure of problem sets or exams etc.
Have a very clear idea on the subject of the paper you want to write, very early on.
Good opportunity to understand forecast and its importance
Start early!
